pullrequest.title: Use hidden symbol visibility by default

content.raw:
That is a good point. The approach is to use hidden by default in the compiler and only enable the needed ones. Since it is quite a fine tunned feature, it is not trivial to know if we are overexposing some symbols that are really not needed. If a big problem appear (such a bug in gcc flags) in a minor or patch version our ABI checker will complain hard.

Others approaches exist: count the number of symbols and check if the increase is insane (imperfect), a test that generate a symbol collision if private classes are not exported, etc. I will need to think a bit more on this.
